mainBoard.name: Quirion Trailblazer
mainBoard.originalText: When Quirion Trailblazer comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your normal limit of playing one land per turn.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.name: Wayfaring Giant
mainBoard.originalText: Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

mainBoard.text: Domain — Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

mainBoard.name: Harrow
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can’t pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.name: Global Ruin
mainBoard.originalText: Each player chooses from the lands he or she controls a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.

rulings.text: If a land counts as multiple basic land types, you can choose it for either or for both of those land types.

You sacrifice all lands other than the chosen ones. Since you can only choose lands with basic land types, any non-basic lands that don’t have a basic land type (even if they have some other land type, as in the case of Cloudpost) are necessarily going to be sacrificed.

mainBoard.text: Each player chooses from the lands they control a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice.
